text:
He unfastened the latch and opened the door. 

He listened on the staircase. 

Voices shouted somewhere far away. 

“What are they about?” he wondered. 

Silence fell suddenly. 

He thought to go out but hesitated. 

A door slammed below. 

Someone hummed a tune while descending. 

“Why do they make such noise?” he thought. 

He closed the door and waited. 

Footsteps echoed from the bottom of the stairs. 

They grew louder, heavy and unhurried. 

“Are they coming for the old woman?” he suspected. 

His heart raced. 

He felt frozen, rooted to the spot. 

The footsteps climbed higher. 

They were coming for him.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The protagonist is anxiously waiting and listening for footsteps, feeling a sense of impending danger as someone approaches.
